comment.author: 30935172@N05
comment._content:
Why is Dr. W. Simon, 
Alfred W. Simon, 
A.W. Simon, Photographer, of Buffalo, N.Y.,
so little known?
Impressive!

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: @ anartist on flickr -- A. (Alfred) W. Simon, of Buffalo, NY, was an American photographer, born in Canada in 1836. He published a large number of albumen print stereographs -- notably of the significant buildings and views in Buffalo, NY and the surrounding environs. Dr. W. (William) Simon, (1843 - 1916), the creator of the photographs in this Autochrome series, was born in Eberstadt, Germany in 1843. He was a Professor of Chemistry at the Baltimore College of Physicians and Surgeons, and was an expert in autochromatic photography. He had the distinction of having taken the first color photograph of a rainbow.(!) --NY Times
